Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: I learned to speak better, since the class was small, and sharpened up on my French grammar skills.
This course provided a deeper understanding of French syntax and semantics through a greater analysis of French texts.
The strengths of this class are how immersive it is. The weakness is how the course material is laid out - L'Etranger is the most challenging and should come at the end of the course

Strength: Pierre was the best professor ever 
weakness: there's only one Pierre and he's not teaching again
I feel like it sometimes can go a little too fast for me, and if one struggles in 120 or 121, it would be hard to pick up 130
This course is well-organized and the teaching staff is highly dedicated to making sure students understand the material and feel confident when speaking the language.
It helps you satisfy the language requirement and it is well taught. However, it takes a lot of time to do well in the course.
I would recommend this course to a student who is interested in improving both their ability to speak French and their overall understanding of French grammar.
